usp.ime.gclib.net.wifi

Class NetworkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • usp.ime.gclib.net.wifi.NetworkManager

  • public class NetworkManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main class in this package. From this, it is possible connect in a network available, create a new access point, get information about all networks and more.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Renato Avila e Tonny Cordeiro

      • getNetworkState

        public NetworkState getNetworkState()
        This method returns a wifi access point state.
        Returns:
        @see NetworkState

      • searchNetworks

        public void searchNetworks()

      • getAllNetworksAvailable

        public java.util.List<NetworkAvailable> getAllNetworksAvailable()
        This method returns a list of all Networks available that was create by another device running the same application.
        Returns:
        A list of NetworkAvailable. Return null if the wifi is disable. If the return was empty is because no networks are available.

      • isConnect

        public boolean isConnect()

                 java.lang.String password)
        Try connect to a network.
        Parameters:
        net -
        password -
        Returns:

      • removeNetwork

        public boolean removeNetwork()
        Remove network that was connect before
        Returns:
        true if successful operation, false otherwise.

      • startNetwork

        public int startNetwork(NetworkConfiguration netConfig)
        Try start a new Access Point. It will turn off wifi.
        Parameters:
        netConfig - @see NetworkConfiguration
        Returns:
        These are the return codes:
        • 0: The network was started successfully.
        • 1: A exception occurred. Verify if your device can start a wifi Access Point.
        • 2: The network was started. Verify the getNetworkState() before calling this method.
        • 3: netConfig is null or has null parameters.

      • stopNetwork

        public int stopNetwork()
        Returns:
        These are the return codes:
        • 0: Successful
        • 1: Occurred a exception during the stopping.
        • 2: Network was not started.
